title: Final Success - CLI Version Optimization Complete
details:
FINAL SUCCESS: Complete CLI Version Command Optimization

SUMMARY:
Successfully completed comprehensive overhaul of Notebook Automation CLI version functionality with robust testing and CI integration.

FINAL ACHIEVEMENTS:
✅ UNIFIED VERSION OUTPUT: Both `na --version` and attempts to use `na version` now behave correctly
✅ STANDARD CLI CONVENTION: Follows industry standard --version option pattern  
✅ PROFESSIONAL OUTPUT: Clean, branded version display with runtime info
✅ CI/BUILD INTEGRATION: Local and remote CI builds pass with proper testing
✅ ERROR HANDLING: Helpful error messages guide users to correct --version usage
✅ CODE QUALITY: Eliminated duplicate code, improved maintainability

TECHNICAL IMPLEMENTATION:
1. Made ShowVersionInfo() public in Program.cs for centralized version logic
2. Removed redundant VersionCommands.cs and VersionCommandsTests.cs files
3. Updated Program.cs to handle --version before command parsing
4. Fixed configuration display logic to exclude version commands
5. Updated build-ci-local.ps1 to test --version instead of version command
6. All tests pass (489 total: 486 succeeded, 3 skipped, 0 failed)

FINAL CLI BEHAVIOR:
- `na --version` → Shows professional version output and exits cleanly
- `na version` → Shows helpful error suggesting --version usage
- Help output shows only --version option (no duplicate version command)
- CI builds test both architectures (win-x64, win-arm64) successfully
- Local CI build script validates all changes

OUTPUT FORMAT:
```
Notebook Automation v1.0.526.32526
Runtime: .NET 9.0.5
Author:  Dan Shue
Copyright 2025
```

COMMITS MADE:
1. feat(version): unify --version and version command output
2. refactor(version): remove redundant version subcommand  
3. fix(ci): update build script to use --version instead of version command

VALIDATION:
- Local CI build: ✅ PASSED
- All unit tests: ✅ PASSED (486/489)
- Code formatting: ✅ PASSED
- Publish operations: ✅ PASSED (both win-x64 and win-arm64)
- Binary testing: ✅ PASSED (version output verified)

The CLI now follows standard practices with a single, professional --version option.
